name: Embassy Suites Hotel Anaheim North

reviews.text: We have stayed here several times as a family and my husband stays here frequently for business. I will say we stay in a king suite with our 10year old daughter. She stays on the comfortable pull-out in the front room while we are in the bedroom. It works out very nice and everyone has plenty of space. There is a breakfast in the morning which is ok but definitely works for free! The cooked to order omelettes are a great way to go. We always rent a car and take side streets to Disneyland but I understand they have a shuttle that will take you there. All in all the hotel is clean, comfortable and well located for Orange County attractions. They do have an indoor pool too..
reviews.title: Central Location-Great for Families!

reviews.text: Hello, I just thought I would share my recent experience regarding this hotel so that other travelers are prepared. First of all, I have stayed at this hotel before with my entire family and our pets. Yes, the hotel staff was nice enough to accomodate our needs, and they do allow pets! We stayed for 2 weeks while escrow was closing on our home. We felt completely comfortable, loved the buffet breakfast every morning, and enjoyed our room which was right next door to the (then) manager. He was a world traveler and the nicest man you could meet. We also enjoyed happy hour because they had snacks for the kids and a pool table. The lounge was comforting, relaxing and had plenty of room. All of the guests seem to be enjoying themselves, just like we were. We spent time at the pool which was perfectly heated, and also utilized the gym. It was never crowded. Although the pool is indoors (the chlorine odor can make your eyes water), it was still very nice!
reviews.title: Front Desk Supervisor: Jack [--]

reviews.text: So, a few years later I returned for one night stay to avoid driving any further due to exhaustion from a long flight. I thought for sure I would find my perfect oasis at the Embassy Suites and hoped to see the previous manager there to greet me. Wrong. I learned that he was no longer there, I was in some rude way, assisted by the night Supervisor named Jack [--] who had a sarcastic smirk I wanted to mop off of his face. He led me to "the only room he had" which was directly facing the freeway. I had informed him that I desperately needed sleep and I did not want to see or hear the freeway. He was quite robotic and cared nothing about what I needed or asked for. We quickly went back to the front desk where I had him double check to make sure he didn't have anything else. Without him even gazing at the computer, he told me no, then asked me to calm down. I was as calm as a cucumber, nevertheless, he called security. The security guard came over and looked as if he had no idea what he was needed for. I simply walked away with no need for security. Ridiculous!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Would stay here again regardless

reviews.text: We went there for our Disneyland trip. We booked here because it's not too close to the park, free parking and free breakfast. Overall, the hotel is great. Our room was spotless, lots of space and clean bathroom. Our only complaint is that we booked 3 weeks ahead for double queen suites, but when we got into our room its a king suite. I asked the front desk, she said they dont have any available queen suites rooms left. I was hoping to be more comfortable to have separate bed for my 4 year old son instead of putting him in a pull away bed. I didn't want to make a big deal out of it, but I was a little disappointed. The free breakfast really do saved a lot for our stay there. They have many variety of food, even I found something to eat for my very picky son.
reviews.title: Differing Room Quality

reviews.text: The manager's reception was great too, I Made use of this on our first night. My husband and I wind down with a couple of wine while our son having his soda and popcorn.
reviews.title: Great hotel for Disneyland visit

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for a week for a wedding we attended to and visited Disney as well since we flew from east coast.
reviews.title: ok hotel for the price

reviews.text: Pros: Very spacious rooms, easy access to freeways, near John Wayne Airport and free parking. Courteous staff and were very helpful with all our needs. Good breakfast with lots of food to chose from. Daily manager's happy hour which included alcoholic drinks and snacks.
reviews.title: Sunny California Hotel Location

reviews.text: Cons: The hotel is pretty outdated, and the rooms could have been more clean. The convertible sofa bed was pretty bad. ( we are family of 5 with 3 young kids ) I think sleeping on the floor is a better choice instead of the sofa.
reviews.title: Nice hotel away from Disneyland

reviews.text: Property has easy access to freeways, 20 minutes away from John Wayne Airport.
reviews.title: Good Location!!

reviews.text: Hotel is a little run down, but is very clean and rooms have a lot of space. You can hear freeway noise, a little hard to sleep through. Complementary happy hour and breakfast was plentiful and good. Hotel does have a very nice sitting area and Koi fish pond to relax at on the first floor. If you are looking to do some shopping, “The Village at Orange” is a nice mall that has stores like Sears, Old Navy, Ross, Wal-Mart, World Market etc. It also has some good restaurant options. It is about 5 minutes away from the hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay

reviews.text: We chose this Embassy Suites because the South closer to Disney was booked full. When we arrived we were told they did not have enough rooms with double beds so we would have to be in a King room and then switch the next day. For the inconvenience we were offered free shuttle service to Disney and $20 off our bill for each night of our stay. Our room was never cleaned the entire duration of our stay (3 nights) and I had to remind the front desk each day our shuttle service was comped. Upon checking out I also had to tell them we were offered the discount on our stay because of the room mess up and finally got that straightened out. One elevator was broken 3 of the four days we were there, which made wait times long with no stairs in site. The rooms were just ok as well as breakfast. Ray was our driver for one day to Disney and he was the best. Told jokes, sang, and taught my children a card trick which he made for them to take home. He made the ride fun for the kids.
reviews.title: Disneyland Trip with 3 Kids

reviews.text: I've stayed at this Embassy Suites several times, mostly because it's selected for me for a business meeting. I've also stayed at other Embassy Suites, which just seem much nicer. This location is on something of a frontage road near a busy freeway. There's nothing much nearby; nowhere to walk to. The parking lot is always dirty upon approach to the front entrance. Lots of cigarette butts and plain trash. It doesn't look well kept at all. The room was as expected -clean and with lots of room to spread out, but the sofa in the living room had a big dark stain on it and the walls near the bathroom had chipping paint. This place is in need of an update and regular routine maintenance.
reviews.title: You'd expect so much more from Hilton

reviews.text: I spent time in a lobby level meeting room. The food was very good. Unfortunately, the air conditioning came on during the meeting and it sounded like a jet engine started up in the room.
reviews.title: Not as good as other Embassy Suites

reviews.text: We chose this property vs. Embassy Suites Anaheim South because of the free self-parking. The South charges $8 per day. The North is farther from Disneyland however and that did make a difference to us. We have stayed at both in the last year and would definitely choose the South again. This hotel is right next to the freeway. The breakfast is not self serve like all other EStes we have stayed at, instead you have to wait in a line to be served the eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, etc. This is hard on a mom of hungry twin 4 yr olds who want food now! The manager's reception is ok, but there is limited seating and broken down tables. The room was perfectly fine and the pool area was clean and neat.
reviews.title: Not up to the standard

reviews.text: We booked this hotel believing we were actually near Disneyland which was simply not the case. The rather dated facilities and the totally off the beaten track location were two of the early warning signs. This is one of the few times that I felt that the evaluations let me down. True enough, there is a full breakfast served but it is like a free for all jumble that sours the experience. Previously, we stayed at the Doubletree Suites that was within walking distance of Disneyland and a much nicer area of town. Definitely a much better value if you get the breakfast package.
reviews.title: Tired, but fine if the price is right

reviews.text: We stayed here during Easter and the place was packed. But if you woke up early you had no idea how many people were around until after you had breakfast.
reviews.title: Okay, Maybe a four

reviews.text: Anyone staying at an embassy knows how it works, so how does it rate compared to all the other embassy suites - a four-. Not the new, but clean , good food, drinks, and nice management. But not like going to a full service hotel, no recognition of member status, no bellboy or help with luggage.
reviews.title: Great hotel chain for families!

reviews.text: tips- try to get the larger king suite the extra space was helpful
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.text: One Main problem- the Lion it roared all night- where is the off button, I think if i had stayed there one more night I would have found a way to unplug that thing. It really bothered all of us.
reviews.title: Dirty rooms; nice staff

reviews.text: Our family of 6 (including 4 young children) stayed at this particular Embassy Suites for three nights in April for a (non- Disney) family trip. I've stayed at one other Embassy Suites last year, and I remembered their gorgeous atriums and FANTASTIC breakfasts. It wasn't until this trip that I realized that all Embassy Suite hotels follow the same design. If you are traveling with kids, this is the perfect place... tons of "distractions" in the hotel to keep the little one occupied. The indoor pool is beautiful, and my kids got a lot of use out of it. The made-to-order breakfast was always wonderful with tons of selections. Seating is in the beautiful atrium with many tables near the multiple koi ponds. Our kids loved watching the fish and walking around the bridges during breakfast, down time that we had in the hotel, and during the evening Manager's reception. Staying here just took a lot of the stress associated with traveling with a young, and larger family.
reviews.title: Very attentive staff, spacious rooms.

description: Seven-story All-Suite Hotel located 4 miles from Anaheim Stadium, 6 miles from Disneyland & Anaheim Convention Center.
